page.title: 06The day of a farmer's son 3
page.content: With the radio going in the tractor my brother and I are happy bobbing up and down planting the brocoli plants. It is when we see our mum at the gateway that it is time for our evening meal. Up goes my Dad's hand signalling that he has seen her and that he is hungry and willing to eat. This meal generally consists of some kind of roast or a hot dish. We quickly eat it up and are usually sitting down until roughly 6.45 after the main news has ended. And by 7.00 pm I am out in the brocoli field again raring to get started once more. With my Dad driving I need to plant the brocoli a little quicker than with my brother and I am often told to plant a little quicker by my brother. In this case most of my rows were the worst of the two rows and I hear shouts of:"What are you like boy" from Dad.
